content: a surface slip_stitch tutorial if you don t have this in your repertoire https //www supergurumi com/crochet-surface-slip-stitches pattern for bib dress starts here the pattern is basically the same as for version 1 up to the bib portion it just has the color changes listed mc = skirt and bib color cc = blouse color bodice using mc chain 25 attach cc and ch1 do not cut the thread when you switch colors you will be using it to crochet the skirt if you do as i do and use the forward loop chain do 25 of those in mc and one regular chain in cc row 1 using cc single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across chain 1 turn 25 single_crochet row 2 single_crochet in first 6 scs chain 6 skip 1 single_crochet single_crochet in next 11 scs ch6 skip 1 single_crochet single_crochet in last 6 scs chain 1 turn 35 sts - 23 single_crochet and 12 chain row 3 decrease single_crochet in each st across including in each chain decrease chain 1 turn 33 single_crochet for an alternate version of row 3 if you don t like crocheting into chains you can sc6 into the space left by the chains in row 2 row 4 sc7 decrease twice sc3 decrease sc2 decrease sc3 decrease twice sc6 27 single_crochet finish off skirt you will be crocheting into the foundation chain at the waist using the mc thread from the foundation chain row 5 chain 1 2 single_crochet in each stitch across chain 2 turn 50 single_crochet now work in rounds round 6 double_crochet to end of row join in the top of the first double_crochet chain 2 round 7 double_crochet to end of row join in the top of the first double_crochet chain 1 round 8 - scalloped hem 1sc 2dc in the first st skip the next st across finish off bib use surface single_crochet to make the bib if this is unfamiliar to you here is a tutorial https //www supergurumi com/surface-single-crochet-stitch-and-other-surface-stitches 2 row 1 with the hem facing downward count 9 of the waist spaces and insert your hook as per the tutorial single_crochet 7 chain 1 turn row 2 single_crochet across 7 single_crochet for straps chain 6 or number needed to reach over shoulder join with a slip_stitch to 3rd and 4th space from the edge at the waist attach thread to other corner of bib and repeat i used forward loop chain for the straps which makes them thicker than a regular chain if you use a regular chain you might want to do this alternate method alternate method for the straps *chain 6 or number needed to reach over shoulder join with a slip_stitch to 3rd and 4th space from the edge at the waist single_crochet in each chain of the strap* single_crochet across the front of the bib repeat between asterisks * for second strap join to top of bib with a slip_stitch finishing weave in all ends
